ns:common.topic.description: SyncCharts is a graphical formalism dedicated to reactive system modeling. It allows specifying the reactive behavior, and the synchronous programming, of applications. SyncCharts is the name of the model. A syncChart is an instance. This language was created by Prof. Charles Andr√©.\nSyncCharts inherits many features from Statecharts, and Argos. An academic distribution is available on Sports Project. A commercial distribution is in Esterel Studio, from Synfora. Any syncChart can be automatically translated into an Esterel program, so users can use the Esterel software environment developed for synchronous programming.
rdfs:label: SyncCharts

ns:common.document.text: SyncCharts is a graphical formalism dedicated to reactive system modeling. It allows specifying the reactive behavior, and the synchronous programming, of applications. SyncCharts is the name of the model. A syncChart is an instance. This language was created by Prof. Charles Andre.\nSyncCharts inherits many features from Statecharts, and Argos. An academic distribution is available on Sports Project. A commercial distribution is in Esterel Studio, from Synfora. Any syncChart can be automatically translated into an Esterel program, so users can use the Esterel software environment developed for synchronous programming.

ns:type.object.name: SyncCharts
